results.name: A103451 * A002260.
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: A103451 * A002260 as infinite lower triangular matrices.
Left border of A002260, (1, 1, 1, 1,...) is replaced by (1, 2, 2, 2,...).
example: First few rows of the triangle are:
mathematica: Table[k + Boole[k == 1 && n != 2], {n, 2, 14}, {k, n - 1}] // Flatten (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jul 19 2016 *)
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Nov 14 2007
